items.v: Added a command line option that can interpret relative paths inside absolute paths.
Improve to display a warning message when the file association tool (AtcSetup.exe) is launched by itself.
Fix the problem that prevented the "Check for program updates..." in the version information from being retrieved updating information properly.
The encryption and decryption processes are speeded up (in particular, the process of calculating the SHA-256 value of the file was reviewed and speeded up).
Fix the problem that command line option arguments were not interpreted correctly when capitalized.

Fix the problem that AttachÃ©Case freezes (infinite loop internally) when the file name was specified using the command line option "/autoname" when there was a file with the same name in the same place.
Fix the problem that an "Unexpected error" occurred when encrypting multiple files with the "Create one encrypted file from files" option and the process did not finish successfully.
Fix the problem that the icon of the encrypted file is not displayed when setting the file association with ver.3.5.2.0 (released on 2020/03/17).
Add an option to always turn on the IMEs of the password input text box. 'Settings' -> 'Window' -> 'Turn on IMEs in all text box for password entry'.
Fix the problem where the mask display of the text box for entering some passwords was turned off.
Fix the problem where an exception occurred when a value exceeding the percentage maximum value of the progress bar was entered.

When the old version of the program files remained, translations such as Japanese were sometimes unsuccessful, so when installing the new version, the installer delete them if confirmed those old files.
Fix the problem that an error dialog may be hidden behind the main window during encryption or decryption if depending on setting of window.

Along with the above bug fixes, when an exception was thrown in FileEncrypt3.cs, ZipEncrypt.cs, FileDecrypt2.cs, and FileDecrypt3.cs, the error dialog box displayed using System.Form.Window has been deleted in the source codes. and then All exception errors were returned to the main window such as Form1, and the UI messages has become to display there.
Fix the problem where the decryption destination drive free space was not checked before decrypting the ver.2 encrypted file.
The layout and design of the main form were reviewed and adjusted slightly.

Fix the problem that the password will not reveal even if "Not mask password character" is checked when you enter the password for "Remember password for encryption" or "Remember password for decryption" in "Operation settings"-> "Password".
Add new buttons of "Online Help" and "Command-Line Reference" in the operation setting window to launch a browser and jump to the web site URL.
Fix that the source code of "Decrypt3.cs" to match the error code internally for the executable format.
Fix the problem where switching language was not performed correctly in a Japanese environment, such as when "Default" was selected for language switching.
Fix the process that the installer downloads automatically when .NET Framework 4.0 is not installed on the OS.
Fix the problem where Japanese translation of the encrypted file association tool "AtcSetup.exe" did not work well.
Add password strength meter (Dropbox's zxcvbn library)
Assign a new code signing certificate to each executable file
Add function to start AtcSetup.exe alone and delete the all of registered registry for AttacheCase
Remove and fixed an unnecessary code in the processing of UTC time stamp at the time of decryption
Fix the problem that a file for which the number until destroys has been set due to a password input error is not correctly deleted

Fix the problem where the text file containing the file list to be processed specified in the command line option "/ list" at startup can not be read correctly if it has a character encoding other than UTF-8
Fix the problem that an unexpected error occurred when the value of "=" character is specified in the command line option
Fix the problem that "/nohide" command line option was not working properly
AttacheCase executable file "AttacheCase.exe" was merged DLL files etc into a single executable file for easy-to-handle.
Improve that overwrite confirmation window etc could be closed or canceled by the ESC key.
Improved that the manually inputted password is used with priority when manually input without using the memorized password.
Fixed with the problem that a input text box was invalid in the memorized encryption / decryption password settings.
Fixed the problem that a file encrypted with ver.2 is dealt with as "invalid path" and can not be decrypted.
Fixed with the problem that an error message was displayed when AttacheCase multiple start-up and close windows.
Since the previous directory traversal measures were insufficient, additional correction was done.

Added countermeasure against vulnerability  that allows arbitrary scripts to be executed when ATC file is decrypted when the malicious modified setting file "_AtcCase.ini" exists at a predetermined position.
Fixed with further directory traversal vulnerabilities.
Other fixes.
Add UTC timestamp to encrypted file ( AttachÃ©Case file ).
Added "Ignore file hash value check" to "Salvage data" option.
Fixed the problem that the "Salvage data" option was not working correctly.

Fixed with the problem that the original file of the decryption destination was destroyed unintentionally when you select "Cancel" in the overwrite confirmation dialog that appears at the time of decryption.
Updated the code signing certificate to a new one.
Attached a code signing certificate to the uninstaller, too.
Modified UTF-8 to process with priority, when holding both Shift-JIS and UTF-8 file list in ver.2 data.
Added output option to replace with the correct character string when there is a character string of an incorrect file name or path name in encrypted data of ver.2.
Fixed the problem that processing was not performed normally when password ZIP was created with the "Create one encrypted file from files"option selected.
Fixed the problem that the programs(AttacheCase.exe, AtcSetup.exe) was not digitally signed.
Fixed the problem of recurrence which encrypted file generated with ver.2 could not be decrypted correctly.
Fixed the problem that folders (multiple files) encrypted with ver.2 could not be decrypted correctly.
Fixed the problem that encrypted file could not be decrypted correctly, when Shift-JIS password is specified for the encrypted file created with ver.2.
Fixed the problem that encrypted file could not be decrypted correctly, if the encrypted file created with ver.2 is read-only.
Fixed the problem that the password input limit was not set correctly in the encrypted file (Before the change, the default 3 times was included always, regardless of setting).
Update internal resources.
Updated revision number as stable version.
Fixed the problem that when trying to output ZIP with password with "Save the encryption files to the same folder" item selected, exception handling error occurred.
Fixed the problem that default "month" setting of "Set encrypted file name automatically" and the format of "month" with the inserted date was incorrect.
Changed that when it is encrypted (or when generating a ZIP with password), the access denied error message to be clearer.
Fixed the problem that if you would encrypt it after selecting ZIP with password item, it would had been going to decryption processing.
Fixed the problem that "decrypting" has been displayed even though the file is deleting.
Fixed the problem that when trying to encrypt the Excel file, the error message appeared as "Now does not correspond to the decryption of password-protected ZIP file.".
Modification of typo in various places in setting window in the English version.
Fixed the problem that the progress at decryption on Windows 10 was not displayed correctly.
Fixed the problem that the association icon was not displayed properly.
Fixed the problem that the Cancel button did not work during the decryption process.
Improved message display when an exception error occurred due to file access denied.
The number of digits in the percentage display during processing was reduced by one digit.
Edited a part of the source code for Windows Store.
Fixed the problem that serial number was not assigned for each file on The 'Set encrypted file name automatically' option.
Fixed the problems that 'Set encrypted file name automatically' option was not setted correctory in command line.
Fixed the problem that when AttacheCase was launched by '_AtcCase.ini', command line option is invalid.
Fixed tha problem that there is a bug in reading the password from the INI file, could be read it
Changed the name of 'Specify the format of the encryption file name' option to 'Set encrypted file name automatically'.
Fixed the some problems that input the format of auto file name in 'Set encrypted file name automatically'.
Inproved that not display dialog to enter parent folder name with 'Create one encrypted file from files' option when 'Set encrypted file name automatically' option is selected.
Fixed the problem with directory traversal vulnerability that the file is expanded to an unintended directory when decrypted an altered encrypted file by a malicious attacker.

Fixed the problem with an access denial error to the folder occurred under a special condition that the folders with the same name overlap when both "Create one encrypted file from files" option and "Create no parent folder in decryption" option are selected.
Improved that when decryption failed with incorrect stored password, even if it is to input the correct password again, the stored password does not have priority.
Fixed with the problem that when decrypting under special conditions that the encrypted file contains 0 byte files or folders, those files could not be successfully decypted.
Fixed with the problem that encrypted files in root directory could not be restored normally before ver.3.2.0.1.
Improved that in the pull-down menu button in overwrite confirmation dialog, when a different item was selected, directly go to processing.
Modified to end as the same flow as the cancellation when the 'Skip All' button is selected in overwrite confirmation dialog.
Fixed the problem that error occured, when the file encrypted in the root directory is tried to decrypt in a different directory.
Fixed the problem with that the message dialog was hidden, when the main form is in a TopMost ( foreground ).
Fixed the problem that when encrypting in initial options, self-executable format is the default.
Fixed with the problem that the file destruction option did not work at all.
Fixed with the problem that the file 'After decryption, open the associated files or folder' option did not work at all.
Minor version up.
The Overwrite confirmation dialog now has 'Overwrite All', 'Keep Newer', 'Keep Newer All', 'Skip', 'Skip All' options.
Fixed the problem that when the memorized password is not used 'without confirming' in option, and then encrypting and decrypting process has been run.
Fixed that 'Passwords Option' has not been used in English version only.
Fixed the problem that trying to password input was not accepted normally, after using the Password File.
Fixed problem with 'self-executable output' that was not able to output in the command line option
Command line options '/front' and '/wmin' have been in so that it cannot coexist ( always overwritten in the latter ).
Fixed problem that when the dialog of overwrite confirmation display in decrypting, not skipping by selecting 'No'.
Fixed problem that the processing of read-only files with encryption and decryption, that had been terminated with an error.
When you have started on the command line options, there was trouble in the processing.
Fixed a bug that always had been out with 'The latest version is released!' when you start a new version for the first time and then you click on the link 'Check for program updates...'.

contents.title: [Changed source code]
items: Fixed that the count of command line options has been incorrect.
There was the problem of 'Check for program updates' because of it was to save the settings, including the version information after application is terminated.

items.v: When 'Set the timestamp of encryption file to original files or directories' option is ON, not the whole, and to hold the time stamp of the first file or folder for each processing.
Modified so that if you gave an explicit 0 to flag variables on the command line options, are given properly FALSE setting.
